item.title: Finished Projects
item.description: SynapsBot In the summer of 2018 and taught my self python 3 and built my first Discord bot for my server. A couple months later, I rewrote the entire project using a fork on the discord.py library, discord rewrite, and still use the bot to this day Application Configs Using Python 3 I wrote a script that backs-up and installs config files for various applications so that I could have the same settings across machines.

item.title: Future Projects
item.description: Here’s a list of projects that I eventually want to complete - A program to automatically download videos from a YouTube playlist Prevent this from happening again. I’m thinking of using webhooks and youtube-dl - Visualize Typeracer data I did something similar already to this on my discord bot already, but I used typeracer’s limited statistics .json for the user. You can export your data to a .

item.title: The complete Nextcloud Ubuntu Guide
item.description: Getting the machine up-to-date sudo apt autoremove sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade Installing Apache - the webserver sudo apt install apache2 systemctl start apache2 systemctl enable apache2- start apache2 on startup If you’ve configured the server right, you should be able to go to your machine’s IP (you can get this via hostname -I) in the webbrowser of your choice and see the “Apache2 Ubuntu Default Page”

item.title: About
item.description: Hello! I’m Max Vogel. I’m a var today = new Date(); //initializes to current date var bday = new Date(); bday.setFullYear(2002); bday.setMonth(7-1); //January is 0 bday.setDate(27); bday.setHours(0); bday.setMinutes(0); var timeDiff = Math.abs(bday.getTime() - today.getTime()); document.write(Math.floor(timeDiff / ((1000 * 60 * 60 * 24 * 365)))); // ceil time in years ([milliseconds] * [seconds] * [min] * [hours] * [days]) year old who goes to Middleton High School.
